unnormalised: So, exam season is like Diwali – you know it's coming, but still end up scrambling at the last minute, right? And in this age of Education Technology, are exam prep apps actually helpful or just another distraction?
normalised: So, exam season is like Diwali – you know it's coming, but still end up scrambling at the last minute, right? And in this age of Education Technology, are exam prep apps actually helpful or just another distraction?

unnormalised: I've been experimenting with a few for my younger sister, Priya, who's preparing for her Class 10 boards (ICSE, folks!). There's the usual suspect, Byju's, which is pretty comprehensive but can feel a bit overwhelming. Then there's Vedantu, which is good for live online sessions – Priya had a great session with a tutor on quadratic equations at 19:00 hrs last Tuesday.

There's the usual suspect, Byju's, which is pretty comprehensive but can feel a bit overwhelming. Then there's Vedantu, which is good for live online sessions – Priya had a great session with a tutor on quadratic equations at seven P M last Tuesday.

unnormalised: I also tried Testbook; the mock tests are pretty close to the real thing, which is a huge plus. Seriously helped her boost her confidence before the Maths paper. She had a tough time with it last year, scoring only 65/100 in the prelims on 26/01/2023.

unnormalised: Honestly, they're tools, right? They only work if you *actually* use them. Priya started off gung-ho, but by week two, she was back to scrolling Instagram during her "study breaks" (surprise!). The key seems to be finding an app that suits your learning style *and* staying disciplined. And maybe setting a timer for those study breaks! Anyone else have app recommendations (or tips for staying focused!)? Good luck to all students facing exams around April 2024! What are your go-to strategies for staying on track?
